alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 06 at 10:33AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN WITH RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... Thunderstorms will produce moderate to heavy rain across portions of northeast Oregon and southeast Washington through Saturday. Rainfall amounts ranging from 0.50 to around 1 inch are expected with local amounts nearing 1.50 inches. This will lead to rises on the rivers and streams across this area as well as ponding of water in low-lying area and fields. In steep terrain locations, there will also be a risk of small rock or mud slides. The heaviest precipitation is expected to occur from tonight through early Saturday, but it will take some time for all the water to reach streams with high water levels expected through Saturday and streams expected to start receding on Sunday.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
